text: Jim Dale, (born James Smith; 15 August 1935) is an English actor, comedian, composer, director and singer-songwriter. He appeared in many of the Carry On movies. He is well known narrating all seven of the Harry Potter audiobooks in the American market."Jim Dale Biography" AllMusic. Retrieved 16 June 2014 He also starred in the Disney movie Pete's Dragon (1977). He was nominated for a BAFTA Award for playing a young Spike Milligan in Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall (1973). ==References== Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:English comedians Category:English composers Category:English movie actors Category:English singer-songwriters Category:English television actors Category:English voice actors Category:Drama Desk Award winners Category:British Grammy Award winners Category:People from Northamptonshire Category:Tony Award winning actors
title: Jim Dale
